publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-271# Mr Jamie McGrigor: Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry—That the Parliament welcomes the detailed report of the Rural Affairs Committee on the impact of amnesic shellfish poisoning but believes that retrospective compensation should be forthcoming for scallop fishermen who, in complying with the ban, have lost their income and recommends that the Executive act on this immediately.
S1M-271# Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry (lodged on 10 November 1999) Mr Murray Tosh*, Phil Gallie*, Dr Winnie Ewing*

S1M-271# Mr Jamie McGrigor: Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry-That the Parliament welcomes the detailed report of the Rural Affairs Committee on the impact of amnesic shellfish poisoning but believes that retrospective compensation should be forthcoming for scallop fishermen who, in complying with the ban, have lost their income and recommends that the Executive act on this immediately. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, Phil Gallie, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr David Davidson*, Ben Wallace*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S1M-271# Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry (lodged on 10 November 1999) Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*
S1M-271# Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry (lodged on 10 November 1999) Mrs Margaret Ewing*, David Mundell*
S1M-271# Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry (lodged on 10 November 1999) Nick Johnston*

S1M-271# Mr Jamie McGrigor: Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry—That the Parliament welcomes the detailed report of the Rural Affairs Committee on the impact of amnesic shellfish poisoning but believes that retrospective compensation should be forthcoming for scallop fishermen who, in complying with the ban, have lost their income and recommends that the Executive act on this immediately. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, Phil Gallie, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Ben Wallace, Mr Brian Monteith, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mrs Margaret Ewing, David Mundell, Mr Nick Johnston, Bill Aitken*
S1M-271# Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry (lodged on 10 November 1999) Fergus Ewing*
S1M-271# Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry (lodged on 10 November 1999) David McLetchie*
S1M-271# Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry (lodged on 10 November 1999) Mr Keith Harding*

S1M-271# Mr Jamie McGrigor: Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry—That the Parliament welcomes the detailed report of the Rural Affairs Committee on the impact of amnesic shellfish poisoning but believes that retrospective compensation should be forthcoming for scallop fishermen who, in complying with the ban, have lost their income and recommends that the Executive act on this immediately. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, Phil Gallie, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Ben Wallace, Mr Brian Monteith, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mrs Margaret Ewing, David Mundell, Mr Nick Johnston, Bill Aitken, Fergus Ewing, David McLetchie, Mr Keith Harding
S1M-271# Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry (lodged on 10 November 1999) Robin Harper*

S1M-271# Mr Jamie McGrigor: Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry—That the Parliament welcomes the detailed report of the Rural Affairs Committee on the impact of amnesic shellfish poisoning but believes that retrospective compensation should be forthcoming for scallop fishermen who, in complying with the ban, have lost their income and recommends that the Executive act on this immediately. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, Phil Gallie, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Ben Wallace, Mr Brian Monteith, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mrs Margaret Ewing, David Mundell, Mr Nick Johnston, Bill Aitken, Fergus Ewing, David McLetchie, Mr Keith Harding, Robin Harper
S1M-271# Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry (lodged on 10 November 1999) Mary Scanlon*
S1M-271# Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry (lodged on 10 November 1999) Mr John Munro*, Mr Jamie Stone*

S1M-271# Mr Jamie McGrigor: Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry—That the Parliament welcomes the detailed report of the Rural Affairs Committee on the impact of amnesic shellfish poisoning but believes that retrospective compensation should be forthcoming for scallop fishermen who, in complying with the ban, have lost their income and recommends that the Executive act on this immediately. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, Phil Gallie, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Ben Wallace, Mr Brian Monteith, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mrs Margaret Ewing, David Mundell, Nick Johnston, Bill Aitken, Fergus Ewing, David McLetchie, Mr Keith Harding, Robin Harper, Mary Scanlon, Mr John Munro, Mr Jamie Stone

S1M-271# Mr Jamie McGrigor: Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry—That the Parliament welcomes the detailed report of the Rural Affairs Committee on the impact of amnesic shellfish poisoning but believes that retrospective compensation should be forthcoming for scallop fishermen who, in complying with the ban, have lost their income and recommends that the Executive act on this immediately. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, Phil Gallie, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Ben Wallace, Mr Brian Monteith, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mrs Margaret Ewing, David Mundell, Nick Johnston, Bill Aitken, Fergus Ewing, David McLetchie, Mr Keith Harding, Robin Harper, Mary Scanlon, Mr John Munro, Mr Jamie Stone

S1M-271# Mr Jamie McGrigor: Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry—That the Parliament welcomes the detailed report of the Rural Affairs Committee on the impact of amnesic shellfish poisoning but believes that retrospective compensation should be forthcoming for scallop fishermen who, in complying with the ban, have lost their income and recommends that the Executive act on this immediately. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, Phil Gallie, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Ben Wallace, Mr Brian Monteith, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mrs Margaret Ewing, David Mundell, Nick Johnston, Bill Aitken, Fergus Ewing, David McLetchie, Mr Keith Harding, Robin Harper, Mary Scanlon, Mr John Munro, Mr Jamie Stone

S1M-271# Mr Jamie McGrigor: Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning Compensation for Scallop Industry—That the Parliament welcomes the detailed report of the Rural Affairs Committee on the impact of amnesic shellfish poisoning but believes that retrospective compensation should be forthcoming for scallop fishermen who, in complying with the ban, have lost their income and recommends that the Executive act on this immediately. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, Phil Gallie, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Ben Wallace, Mr Brian Monteith, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mrs Margaret Ewing, David Mundell, Nick Johnston, Bill Aitken, Fergus Ewing, David McLetchie, Mr Keith Harding, Robin Harper, Mary Scanlon, Mr John Munro, Mr Jamie Stone
